intro: Eriocaulon truncatum var. truncatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. This variety is notable for its ability to thrive in moist to submerged conditions, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
